Generation V.Black: It lures people in with its Poké Ball pattern, then releases poison spores. Why it resembles a Poké Ball is unknown.
Generation V.White: For some reason, this Pokémon resembles a Poké Ball. They release poison spores to repel those who try to catch them.
Generation V.Black 2: It lures Pokémon with its pattern that looks just like a Poké Ball then releases poison spores.
Generation V.White 2: It lures Pokémon with its pattern that looks just like a Poké Ball then releases poison spores.

Generation VI.X: It lures people in with its Poké Ball pattern, then releases poison spores. Why it resembles a Poké Ball is unknown.
Generation VI.Y: It lures Pokémon with its pattern that looks just like a Poké Ball, then releases poison spores.
Generation VI.Omega Ruby: It lures people in with its Poké Ball pattern, then releases poison spores. Why it resembles a Poké Ball is unknown.
Generation VI.Alpha Sapphire: It lures Pokémon with its pattern that looks just like a Poké Ball, then releases poison spores.

Generation VIII.Sword: No one knows what the Poké Ball-like pattern on Foongus means or why Foongus has it.
Generation VIII.Shield: The spores released from this Pokémon's hands are highly poisonous, but when thoroughly dried, the spores can be used as stomach medicine.

Generation IX.Scarlet: There is a theory that the developer of the modern-day Poké Ball really liked Foongus, but this has not been confirmed.
Generation IX.Violet: This Pokémon prefers damp places. It spurts out poison spores to repel approaching enemies.

Generation V.Black: Routes 6 , 7 , and 10 (both in tall grass and as fake items)
Generation V.White: Routes 6 , 7 , and 10 (both in tall grass and as fake items)
Generation V.Black 2: Routes 6 and 7 (both in tall grass and as fake items * ) Routes 5 , 6 , and 13 ( Hidden Grotto )
Generation V.White 2: Routes 6 and 7 (both in tall grass and as fake items * ) Routes 5 , 6 , and 13 ( Hidden Grotto )

Generation VI.X: Routes 15 , 16 , and 20 , Pokémon Village ( Horde Encounter )
Generation VI.Y: Routes 15 , 16 , and 20 , Pokémon Village ( Horde Encounter )

Generation IX.Scarlet: East Province: Tagtree Thicket West Province: Area Three North Province: Area Two Tera Raid Battles ( 2★ )
Generation IX.Violet: East Province: Tagtree Thicket West Province: Area Three North Province: Area Two Tera Raid Battles ( 2★ )
